item.title: Hugo is so nice, I migrated twice
item.description: After changing my blog and poetry site build systems to Hugo, I thought why not move everything to Hugo?

item.title: Same Blog, Different Build. On to Hugo!
item.description: I migrated my blog to Hugo! I’ve been using Jekyll to build my blogging site for the past couple years but I read that it is no longer actively supported. Several bloggers I follow have made the switch to Hugo and claim the build speed is a lot faster. Though that’s not really a concern for me at the moment, if I keep publishing here I’ll eventually run into those problems.

item.title: Musings on AI pt 2
item.description: Though I don’t feel anything from pt 1 was incorrect, I wanted lend a bit more credulity to AI and Machine Learning work. I’m gonna reference mostly work and posts from a machine learning engineer and tech writer I follow, Vicki Boykis. She has a great post from Feb 2023 on Chat GPT titled “What should you use Chat GPT for?”. Part of her assessment from then:

item.title: Musings on AI
item.description: I’m trying to get in the habit of blogging a bit more frequently so this will seem less collected than other posts.

item.title: The Bear show us how to grow
item.description:
(Minor spoilers for The Bear season 2 lie ahead)

Episode four of season two of The Bear takes a slight detour from a Chicago family restaurant aiming to reinvent itself to a high-end kitchen in the Netherlands. The Chicago shop’s head chefs send their baker, Marcus, to Copenhagen to learn some new dishes from a pastry chef named Luca.

item.title: Please don't make me kill
item.description: A WSJ op-ed made its rounds through my little corner of lefty twitter. I’m not a subscriber, so I did not read it. Take this post with however big a grain of salt you feel appropriate.
